pull.title: script: Add Keyserver to verify-commits README
pull.body:
When I use the option with the default keyserver on `gpg (GnuPG) 2.2.12` from the Debian repositories only the keys from meshcollider and fanquake are actually found. Using the ubuntu keyserver works without any problems and all keys are getting found.
As this keyserver is also suggested on [https://bitcoincore.org/en/download/](), it would be good to have a common keyserver.

rename.to: script: Add Keyserver to verify-commits README

script: Add Keyserver to verify-commits README

events.message: script: Add Keyserver to verify-commits README

events.body:
LGTM

```
10:52AM /Users/paymahn/bitcoin master
 ❮❮❮ gpg --recv-keys $(<contrib/verify-commits/trusted-keys)
gpg: key 944D35F9AC3DB76A: public key "Michael Ford (bitcoin-otc) <fanquake@gmail.com>" imported
gpg: key D300116E1C875A3D: public key "MeshCollider <dobsonsa68@gmail.com>" imported
gpg: key 3648A882F4316B9B: new key but contains no user ID - skipped
gpg: key 29D4BCB6416F53EC: new key but contains no user ID - skipped
gpg: key 860FEB804E669320: new key but contains no user ID - skipped
gpg: key 74810B012346C9A6: new key but contains no user ID - skipped
gpg: Total number processed: 6
gpg:           w/o user IDs: 4
gpg:               imported: 2
10:52AM /Users/paymahn/bitcoin master
 ❯❯❯ gpg --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys $(<contrib/verify-commits/trusted-keys)
gpg: key 944D35F9AC3DB76A: "Michael Ford (bitcoin-otc) <fanquake@gmail.com>" not changed
gpg: key D300116E1C875A3D: "MeshCollider <dobsonsa68@gmail.com>" not changed
gpg: key 3648A882F4316B9B: public key "Marco Falke <marco.falke@tum.de>" imported
gpg: key 29D4BCB6416F53EC: public key "Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch>" imported
gpg: key 860FEB804E669320: public key "Pieter Wuille <pieter.wuille@gmail.com>" imported
gpg: key 74810B012346C9A6: public key "Wladimir J. van der Laan <laanwj@visucore.com>" imported
gpg: Total number processed: 6
gpg:               imported: 4
gpg:              unchanged: 2
```

@paymog Welcome to Bitcoin Core :)
We don't use terms like LGTM here. We have a list of our "slang" [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#peer-review).
In your case you probably meant "ACK".
Also thanks for the log

Thank you! Understood, I'll probably make more mistakes as I ramp up on
Bitcoin but I intend to help review and write code.
